testcase.description: Tests core functionality in the framework

case.name: Frame005a
case.description: Verify information from the getHeaders() method

case.name: Frame007a
case.description: Extract all information from the getProperty in the BundleContext interface

case.name: Frame010a
case.description: Get context id, location and status of the bundle

case.name: Frame018a
case.description: Test result of getService(null). Should throw NPE

case.name: Frame019a
case.description: Try bundle:// syntax, if present in FW, by installing bundleA_test This test is also valid if new URL(bundle://) throws MalformedURLException

case.name: Frame020a
case.description: Load bundleA_test and check that it exists and that its expected service does not exist Also check that the expected events in the framework occurs

case.name: Frame025b
case.description: Start bundleA_test and check that it gets state ACTIVE and that the service it registers exist

case.name: Frame030b
case.description: Stop bundleA_test and check that it gets state RESOLVED

case.name: Frame035b
case.description: Uninstall bundleA_test and check that it gets state UNINSTALLED

case.name: Frame038b
case.description: Install a non existent file, check that the right exception is thrown

case.name: Frame041a
case.description: Install bundleD1_test, which has a broken manifest file, an empty import statement and check that the expected exceptions are thrown

case.name: Frame045a
case.description: Add a service listener with a broken LDAP filter to get an exception

case.name: Frame050a
case.description: Loads and starts bundleB_test, checks that it gets the state ACTIVE. Checks that it implements the Configurable interface.

case.name: Frame055a
case.description: Load and start bundleC_test, checks that it gets the state ACTIVE. Checks that it is available under more than one name. Then stop the bundle, check that no exception is thrown as the bundle unregisters itself in its stop method.

case.name: Frame060a
case.description: Gets the configurable object from testbundle B, update its properties and check that a ServiceEvent occurs. Also get the ServiceRegistration object from bundle and check that the bundle is the same and that unregistration causes a ServiceEvent.UNREGISTERING.

case.name: Frame065b
case.description: Load and try to start bundleE_test, It should be possible to load , but should not be possible to start as the start method in the manifest is not available in the bundle.

case.name: Frame068a
case.description: Tests accessing multiple resources inside the test bundle itself using ClassLoader.getResource

case.name: Frame069a
case.description: Tests contents of multiple resources inside the test bundle itself using ClassLoader.getResource

case.name: Frame070a
case.description: Reinstalls and the updates testbundle_A. The version is checked to see if an update has been made.

case.name: Frame075a
case.description: Uninstall bundleB_test and the try to start and stop it. In both cases exceptions should be thrown.

case.name: Frame080a
case.description: Installs and starts bundleF_test and then try to and stop it. A BundleException is expected.

case.name: Frame085b
case.description: Installs and starts bundleH_test, a service factory and tests that the methods in that API works.

case.name: Frame110b
case.description: Install and start bundleJ_test, which should throw an exception at start. then check if the framework removes all traces of the bundle as it registers one service (itself) before the bundle exception is thrown

case.name: Frame115a
case.description: Test getDataFile() method.

case.name: Frame125a
case.description: Test of the PackagePermission class

case.name: Frame130a
case.description: Test of the ServicePermission class

case.name: Frame160a
case.description: Test bundle resource retrieval.

case.name: Frame161a
case.description: Test bundle resource retrieval from boot class path; a resource in-side the java package.

case.name: Frame162a
case.description: Test bundle resource retrieval from boot class path; a resource outside the java package that should not be found.

case.name: Frame163a
case.description: Test bundle resource retrieval from boot class path; a resource found via boot delegation.

case.name: Frame164a
case.description: Test normalization of relative paths in bundle URLs created using new URL(bundleUrl, 'relative path').

case.name: Frame165a
case.description: bundle.getResource("/META-INF") and bundle.getResource("/META-INF/") i.e., asking for directory with or without trailing file separator.

case.name: Frame170a
case.description: Test of ServiceReference.getUsingBundles() and SynchronousBundleListener.

case.name: Frame175a
case.description: Check of resource integrity when using intermixed reading of differenent resources from bundleR2_test.

case.name: Frame180a
case.description: Check of resource on top of bundle name space from bundleR3_test.

case.name: Frame181a
case.description: Check of resource on top of bundle name space from bundleR3_test.

case.name: Frame185a
case.description: Check of resource on top of bundle name space from bundleR4_test, that has an unresolvable package imported

case.name: Frame186a
case.description: Check of resource on top of bundle name space from bundleR4_test, that has an unresolvable package imported

case.name: Frame190a
case.description: Check of resource access inside bundle name space from bundleR5_test and bundleR6_test, that bundleR5_test exports a resource that is accessed via the bundle context of bundleR6_test

case.name: Frame210a
case.description: Deadlock test when using synchronous serviceChange listener and updating different threads.

case.name: Frame260a
case.description: Start bundleA_lazy according to its activation policy, check that it gets state STARTING. Then start the bundle eagerly and check that its state is ACTIVE and that the service it registers exist

case.name: Frame265a
case.description: Restart bundleA_lazy according to its activation policy, check that it gets state STARTING. Then load a class from it, check that is started and its state is ACTIVE and that the service it registers exist

case.name: Frame270a
case.description: Start newly installed bundleA_lazy according to its activation policy, check that it gets state STARTING. Then load a class from it, check that is started and its state is ACTIVE and that the service it registers exist

case.name: Frame275a
case.description: Start newly installed bundleA_lazy according to its activation policy, check that it gets state STARTING. Then load a class from it that shall not trigger activation, check that the bundle is still in state STARTING. Load a class that shall trigger activation and check that the state changes to ACTIVE and that the service it registers exist

case.name: Frame280a
case.description: Start newly installed bundleA_lazy according to its activation policy, check that it gets state STARTING. Then load a class from it that shall not trigger activation (via excludes directive), this class depends on another class thatt will be loaded and is not mentioned in either the includes nor the excludes directive. Thus this second class will will trigger activation. Check that the state changes to ACTIVE and that the service it registers becomes available.

case.name: Frame285a
case.description: Start newly installed bundleA_lazy according to its activation policy, check that it gets state STARTING. Then load a class from it that shall not trigger activation (via excludes directive), check that the bundle is still in state STARTING. Load a class that shall trigger activation (via includes directive) and check that the state changes to ACTIVE and that the service it registers exist

case.name: Frame290a
case.description: Start bundleT_test that sleeps 3s in start, at the same time try to stop the bundle, we should get an exception and the bundle should remain started. Then stop and start again and at the same time uninstall this time the bundle should be uninstalled correctly.
